question.body: Which of the following is not matched with its primary function and its secondary endocrine function?

multiple_choice.choice: Heart: Primary function is pump blood; secondary endocrine function ANP to reduce blood volume.
Kidney: Primary function is filter blood and produce urine; secondary endocrine function promotes satiety.
GI tract: Primary function digestion, absorption, excretion of nutrients and wastes. Secondary endocrine function gastrin to aid in digestion.
Thymus: Primary function mature T-cells; secondary endocrine function thymosins to aid the immune system.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the primary function and secondary endocrine function of the heart.
Correct. This is the primary function of the kidney but promoting satiety (the feeling of fullness) is not one of the three secondary endocrine functions of the kidneys.
Incorrect. This is the primary function and the secondary endocrine function of the GI tract.
Incorrect. This is the primary function and secondary endocrine function of the thymus.
